alert.note: Alert for Cocke; Greene; Jefferson; Sevier; Unicoi (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 07 at 3:30PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Cocke, Greene, Jefferson, Sevier and Unicoi. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greeneville, Sevierville, Newport, Pigeon Forge, Tusculum, Baneberry, Parrottsville, Pittman Center, Del Rio, Bybee, Hartford, Caney Branch, Round Mountain, Cosby, Cedar Creek, Chestnut Hill, Bird Crossing, Fairgarden, Camp Creek and Harrisburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
